abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Secondary Education Enhancement Project (SEEP) for Egypt is
            to establish the basis for an equitable education system by
            improving the quality and opportunity in secondary education
            through: a) increasing access to general secondary education
            through upgrading commercial schools to technological
            general schools and providing flexible options for study
            within and between branches of the system; b) better
            aligning curricula and assessment with the skills needs of
            employers and higher education; c) providing professional
            development for teachers and administrators on new
            technologies, curricula, assessment and management
            techniques; and d) by strengthening institutional capacity.
            The project has disbursed a total of SDR34.79 million
            (US$53.66 million equivalent) and the reallocation will make
            it possible to fully disburse the project funds. During the
            last year, the project has made significant progress in
            completing and getting Ministerial approval of a Core
            Curriculum, rehabilitating project schools to bring them up
            to standards so they can be accredited by the by the
            National Quality Assurance and Accreditation Authority
            (NQAAA) according to a recent quality initiative undertaken
            by the Ministry of Education (MOE); equipping schools with
            multipurpose science and computer labs; and training
            teachers, school principals, school managers and members of
            the education boards. The reallocation is necessary to
            complete the rehabilitation of project target schools which
            in turn will help these schools meet minimum infrastructure
            standards required for accreditation by the NQAAA.
